channel.title: PyBites - Data
channel.description: A Community that Masters Python through Code Challenges

item.title: Automating PyBites Review Post Using Github API and collections.defaultdict
item.description: In this post I share a quick script I produced last week to automate a portion of our review post. There are some nice idioms that you might find useful.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: Data Analysis of Pybites Community Branch Activity
item.description: I wanted to play around with a dataset and see what I could find out about it. I decided on analyzing the little bit of data that I could collect from Github without having to use an OAuth key, which limits it to just 300 events. If you want to follow along with my notebook check out the instructions here. This notebook was my submission for Code Challenge 47 - PyBites First Year in Data (Special).
item.dc:creator: Martin Uribe

item.title: Using Pandas and Seaborn to solve PyBites Marvel Challenge
item.description: Today we have Martin Smith show us how he used Pandas and Seaborn to solve our Marvel Comics Challenge. Take it away Martin!
item.dc:creator: Martin Smith

item.title: Visualizing website and social media metrics with matplotlib [notebook]
item.description: in this notebook i use matplotlib.pyplot to create simple yet powerful visualizations of pybites twitter activity, our blog's tag usage and our website traffic. Lastly I use Google trends to see popularity of various social media.
item.dc:creator: Bob

item.title: Read the stdlib: deque
item.description: Use collections.deque to rotate letters in string (or elements in list). It has a native method which performs faster too.
item.dc:creator: Bob
